title: 007 Quantum of Solice Trailer - Font Used on Computer Display
content:
About 50 seconds into Trailer 2 for the new 007 movie, Quantum of Solice, there is a pretty fancy computer display that looks like it uses a single font at numerous different sizes. This font is clean and crisp, and I’d love to know what it is.

There is a sample below; you can also find the trailer here:  
 [http://www.apple.com/trailers/sony\_pictures/quantumofsolace/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928173458/http:/www.apple.com/trailers/sony_pictures/quantumofsolace/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928173458im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/query_dominic_greene_5431.png)

Thanks!

 [‹ Modern looking sans serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928173458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49827 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please HELP ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928173458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49829 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pjorg

comments.content:
I think it’s Franklin Gothic Compressed.

- Lex

Maybe not - I can’t find anything with that ’Q’.

- Lex
Fantastic, thanks. Even the numbers match, which was what was screwing me up.

If I had seen those, I would have IDed it right away. Interstate has very distinctive numbers.

- Lex
